About Me

Passion & Exploration

Always More To Learn

I'm always looking for a new challenge. Every day something new comes out in the world of design and development and along with that comes new problems to solve. Tackling these problems helps me to grow as a thinker, as a designer, as a developer and as a creative in general.

I have had the privilege of working with companies like AT&T and T-Mobile doing print advertising and building websites & responsive web apps with RevSystems, Inc as the Lead Designer

At RevSystems, I spent a lot of time trying to build some new styles of CSS frameworks that could handle all the problems that responsive design presented.

In 2012, I joined Obama for America, President Barack Obama's re-election campaign as a UX Engineer & Front-End Developer. I worked under the Lead Developer, Jeffrey Louden for a while, improving the UX of BarackObama.com and then moved over to the Contribute team under Kyle Rush, the Deputy Director of Development. We built some pretty fun stuff, broke some all of the records, and elected a president.

Following election day, I moved out to San Francisco and built Fluence.

Speaking & Conferences

I have spoken at a few conferences on topics ranging from experience working on a presidential campaign, to writing scalable front-end code for large projects. Some of those are below:

  • Sound "Building Obama, Part 2" CSS Dev Conf Estes Park, CO   —   Oct. 21-23, 2013
  • Sound "Building Obama" Keynote Address, Thinking Creatively Conference Union, NJ   —   Apr. 18-20, 2013
